description: Arsenical Keratosis is a skin condition caused by chronic exposure to arsenic. It is characterized by thickened, rough, and discolored patches on the skin.
possible causes: Chronic exposure to arsenic in contaminated water or food
Occupational exposure to arsenic in industries like mining or smelting
symptoms: Thickened, rough patches on the skin
treatments: Topical treatments to improve skin appearance
Consulting a dermatologist for specialized care
